page.title: 03PRINCE'S GOLF COURSE (Cont)
page.content:
Again during the Second World War the site was occupied by the army and after the war, in 1948, there was a scheme to turn it into a permanent military training area. Sir Aynsley Bridgeland was successful in preventing this. He had the derelict buildings reconstructed and the land cleared of broken down tanks, concrete, barbed wire and tank-traps. By 1949 he had re-created the course on the most up to date lines.
In 1985 a new clubhouse was built at, a mile to the north of the old one. Costing Â£750000 this new facility was able to provide breakfast, lunch, tea, dinner or bar snacks, with a restaurant seating up to 100 guests. The old clubhouse was converted into accommodation to augment that already provided by the adjacent Dormy House.
